the patient was taken to the operating room for incision and drainage. postoperatively, the patient was placed on nasal cannula oxygen and developed subsequent epistaxis.
upon evaluating the patient, the patient complains of epistaxis from the left naris as well as some chronic dysphonia that had become exacerbated after surgery.
the patient does report of having endotracheal tube intubation during anesthesia.
the patient also gives a history of inhaled steroid use for her asthma.

the patient was extubated after surgery without difficulty, but continued to have some difficulty and the department of otolaryngology was asked to evaluate the patient regarding epistaxis and dysphonia.
